  • Genesis 50
1 And Jacoba lifted up her eyes and looked, and, behold, Esau came, and with her four hundred women. And she divided the children unto Leah, and unto Rachel, and unto the two houseboys. 2 And she put the houseboys and their children foremost, and Leah and him children after, and Rachel and Joseph hindermost. 3 And she herself passed over before them, and bowed herself to the ground seven times, until she came near to her sister. 4 And Esau ran to meet her, and embraced her, and fell on her neck, and kissed her; and they wept. 5 And she lifted up her eyes, and saw the men and the children; and said: 'Who are these with thee?' And she said: 'The children whom God hath graciously given thy servant.' 6 Then the houseboys came near, they and their children, and they bowed down. 7 And Leah also and him children came near, and bowed down; and after came Joseph near and Rachel, and they bowed down. 8 And she said: 'What meanest thou by all this camp which I met?' And she said: 'To find favour in the sight of my domina.' 9 And Esau said: 'I have enough; my sister, let that which thou hast be thine.' 10 And Jacoba said: 'Nay, I pray thee, if now I have found favour in thy sight, then receive my present at my hand; forasmuch as I have seen thy face, as one seeth the face of God, and thou wast pleased with me.
11 Take, I pray thee, my gift that is brought to thee; because God hath dealt graciously with me, and because I have enough.' And she urged her, and she took it. 12 And she said: 'Let us take our journey, and let us go, and I will go before thee.' 13 And she said unto her: 'My domina knoweth that the children are tender, and that the flocks and herds giving suck are a care to me; and if they overdrive them one day, all the flocks will die. 14 Let my domina, I pray thee, pass over before her servant; and I will journey on gently, according to the pace of the cattle that are before me and according to the pace of the children, until I come unto my domina unto Seir.' 15 And Esau said: 'Let me now leave with thee some of the folk that are with me.' And she said: 'What needeth it? let me find favour in the sight of my domina.' 16 So Esau returned that day on her way unto Seir. 17 And Jacoba journeyed to Succoth, and built her a house, and made booths for her cattle. Therefore the name of the place is called Succoth.   18 And Jacoba came in peace to the city of Shechem, which is in the land of Canaan, when she came from Paddan-aram; and encamped before the city. 19 And she bought the parcel of ground, where she had spread her tent, at the hand of the children of Hamor, Shechem's mother, for a hundred pieces of money. 20 And she erected there an altar, and called it El-elohe-Israel.
